column4: well I was booted into text mode and the result is till the same
I've enter the correct command and the computer just rebooted
then I was entered into text mode login form
I then type usermod -l ubuntu ubuntu2009
oh but it seemed that it did
I can't seem to exit this phase
so I directly rebooted my computer again
Yes like you said it had switched run levels but I reboot the computer directly because I can't exit.
recovery mode? But wouldn't it produce the same result
okay, but it would ask you to login and you need to type the password. So it might not work.
hm, what would be the basic requirements for an accepted username?
password? Yes.
wait so I'll use the command using root power; sudo usermod -l
Then I'll login as root?
well it might be dangerous if I access the root account but could I have create another user account
dangerous?
how dangerous?
well not exactly but it isn't enabled by default
recovery mode is strictly for that
on recovery mode it is enabled!
alright then, so I'll return to the text mode which is sudo init 1.
well then I'll be back.
